summary: Project focused on removing backend authentication requirements so all backend methods are public and require no caller identity.
architectural_notes: Backend should have no authentication/authorization checks; all methods are publicly callable (remove shared(msg)/caller-identity enforcement).

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove all backend authentication checks so every backend method is public (no caller identity required)

Remove all backend authorization/permission enforcement so that no canister method traps or rejects based on caller identity or role. Specifically, delete the AccessControl-based guards and any "Unauthorized" traps from all methods that currently check admin/user permissions (e.g., purchase admin actions, product admin actions, and user profile methods).

Ensure the backend still compiles and the public Candid interface remains usable by the existing frontend after removing authorization checks (i.e., keep method names and parameter/return types compatible unless strictly necessary). If any AccessControl-only endpoints become unnecessary, either keep them as non-enforcing/no-op helpers or adjust them in a way that does not break the current frontend build.

projectName: Remove all backend authorization checks so every method is callable without authentication
